title: The Block's Tess breaks down in tears and threatens to leave the show
text:
Tess Cattana burst into tears on Monday's episode of The Block, threatening to leave because she wasn't happy with the judges' scores.

Her emotional breakdown came after she and husband Luke Struber finished in last place in the latest room reveal.

'I'm just about done... I'm ready to go!' she told Luke after judge Shaynna Blaze gave them a score of 7.5 out of 10, despite saying she loved the space.

'I'm done, I'm ready to go!' The Block's Tess broke down in tears and threatened to QUIT on the show on Monday, after she and Luke come last in their latest room reveal

Luke added: 'They're having a f**king laugh!'

After scoring a total of 24.5 out of 30 for their courtyard, Tess broke down in tears.

'I'm devastated,' she said, explaining that she was frustrated because the scores did not reflect the judges' feedback.

Their space: After scoring a total of 24.5 out of 30 for their courtyard (pictured), Tess broke down in tears

Emotional: 'I'm devastated,' she said, explaining that she was frustrated because the scores did not reflect the judges' feedback

She added: 'I'm sick of this s**t, I'm over it, I'm done, it's bulls**t!'

Jesse and Mel won the latest room reveal with an impressive score of 29.5, pocketing a $10,000 cash prize.

Mitch and Mark placed second by half a point, finishing with a score of 29.

Winners are grinners! Jesse and Mel (pictured) won the latest room reveal with an impressive score of 29.5, pocketing a $10,000 cash prize

Earlier in the episode, Shaynna said that she 'loved the colour palette' and the tiles in Tess and Luke's courtyard.

The judges also agreed the spiral staircase was an excellent touch, but said the space needed to be softened with furnishings like cushioned seats.

They also suggested adding a barbecue to make it a proper outdoor entertaining area, but the couple didn't have the budget for one.
description: Tess Cattana burst into tears on  Monday's episode of The Block, threatening to leave because she wasn't happy with the judges' scores.
authors: Chloe-Lee Longhetti For Daily Mail Australia
